questions.question: What causes day and night on the Earth?
questions.answer: Rotation of the Earth

questions.question: In which direction does the Earth rotate?
questions.answer: West to East

questions.question: How long does the Earth take to complete one rotation?
questions.answer: 24 hours

questions.question: How many degrees does the Earth rotate in one hour?
What is the local time of a place based on?
questions.answer: Sun’s position

questions.question: How many minutes does local time change per degree of longitude?
questions.answer: 4 minutes

questions.question: Places on the same longitude have the same ____.
questions.answer: Local time

questions.question: Which longitude is used to decide standard time?
questions.answer: Prime Meridian

questions.question: Why was standard time introduced?
questions.answer: All of these

questions.question: Which city’s longitude is used for Indian Standard Time (IST)?
questions.answer: Allahabad (Prayagraj)

questions.question: What is local time?
questions.answer: Local time is the time of a place determined by the position of the sun at that place.

questions.question: Why do different longitudes have different local times?
questions.answer: Because the Earth rotates from west to east, different longitudes face the sun at different times.

questions.question: Define standard time.
questions.answer: Standard time is the uniform time fixed for a country or region based on a selected longitude.

questions.question: Why is Indian Standard Time necessary?
questions.answer: India has a wide longitudinal extent; a single standard time avoids confusion.

questions.question: How much time difference occurs between two places one degree apart in longitude?
questions.answer: There is a difference of 4 minutes per degree of longitude.
